intro: Rytigynia glabra, commonly known as the smooth rytigynia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rytigyniaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy or smooth depending on the variety. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species in its native habitat.
